channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- NBDE Tang Server
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- NBDE Tang Server

item.title: CVE-2024-9355|2024-10-01T18:37:53.436Z -- red%20hat -- nbde%20tang%20server
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Golang FIPS OpenSSL. This flaw allows a malicious user to randomly cause an uninitialized buffer length variable with a zeroed buffer to be returned in FIPS mode. It may also be possible to force a false positive match between non-equal hashes when comparing a trusted computed hmac sum to an untrusted input sum if an attacker can send a zeroed buffer in place of a pre-computed sum. It is also possible to force a derived key to be all zeros instead of an unpredictable value. This may have follow-on implications for the Go TLS stack.
